document_data.name: Artillerist
document_data.mainbody:
'''Artillerists''' were those [[artificer]]s that chose to construct and utilize [[magic]]ally explosive devices, such as [[firearm]]s and hand-held [[cannon]]s.

{{quote|Sure, you can help me calibrate the aiming mechanism. Stand over there.|''Anonymous artillerist.''{{Cite MTG|CLB|182|[[Artillerist|Ingenious Artillerist]]|[[Gaboleps]]}}}}
document_data.Culture: The distinct creativity and ingenuity artillerists displayed for laying pure destruction across battlefields made them highly sought after by commanders and generals across the Realms. During times of peace, they often concentrated their efforts to help prevent ongoing conflicts.
document_data.Abilities:
Artillerists typically utilized a certain set of spells that they learned throughout their career. Among these were: ''[[Shield (spell)|shield]]'', ''[[thunderwave]]'', ''[[scorching ray]]'', ''[[shatter]]'', ''[[fireball]]'', ''[[wind wall]]'', ''[[ice storm]]'', ''[[wall of fire]]'', ''[[cone of cold]]'', and ''[[wall of force]]''.

In addition to other tools and devices, they trained themselves in the use of [[woodcarver's tools]]. Experienced artillerists learned how to use these tools to customize arcane [[implement]]s―namely [[rod]]s, [[wand]]s, and [[stave]]s―into magical firearms to conduct spells they cast. By utilizing specific arcane sigils, these firearms dealt significantly more damage than when wielded in the hands of others.
document_data.Possessions:
[[File:Artillerist Tasha.png|thumb|right|250px|''A human artillerist with his flamethrower eldritch cannon.'']]
One of the first unique devices artillerists learned to craft were [[eldritch cannon]]s. Functioning as a type of magical ordnance, these cannons were highly customizable and could deliver destruction in a variety of different ways. Eldritch cannons could be hand-held in size, or mounted upon stands for additional stability. Types of eldritch cannons included:

* Flamethrower, which projected jets of flame outwards up to {{SI|15|ft}}.
* Force ballista, which shot out bolts of pure [[force energy]] to to a range of {{SI|120|ft}}.
* Protector, which released a pulse of [[positive energy]] that bolstered the life force of allies within a {{SI|10|ft}} radius.

As they continued throughout their careers, artillerists mastered the art of warfare utilizing their arcane cannons. They developed techniques to make their cannons more destructive, implemented self-destruction contingencies, and created fortified defenses of shimmering magical energy. Mastere artillerists were so adept at their craft, they could crew and maintain two arcane cannons at once.
